subject: Management
title: When to Compete
description: A quick win: understand When to Compete.

hook.text: A safety officer overruled the entire team to halt a dangerous process. Nobody thanked him. Until later.

buildup.text: Competing means pushing your position firmly. It feels aggressive. Sometimes it's necessary.

discovery.text: Use competing when safety is at risk, values are non-negotiable, or quick action is critical.

twist.text: Overusing competition destroys trust. But refusing to compete when stakes are high is cowardice.

climax.text: Compete rarely but decisively. When the line is clear, hold it.

punchline.text: Some hills are worth standing on. Know which ones.

quiz.question: When is the competing conflict style most appropriate?
options: When safety is at risk or values are non-negotiable
During routine disagreements about project priorities
Whenever you feel strongly about any opinion
